title: Ticket #2677: condor_softkill doesn't work reliably on Windows 7
description:
condor_softkill fails to enumerate desktops when run non-interatively on Windows 7 (and probabably Vista as well). The softkill log shows 
entering enum_winsta_proc, winsta_name = msswindowstation
OpenDesktop error: 2
This indicates that the "mswindowstation" does not have a desktop called "default". Thus condor_softkill fails to find a window associated with the given pid and thus never tries to send a WM_CLOSE. No other window stations show up in the enumeration (not even WinSta0 which is known to exist).

On windows XP, the log contains 

entering enum_winsta_proc, winsta_name = WinSta0
OpenWindowStation error: 5
entering enum_winsta_proc, winsta_name = Service-0x0-3e7$
OpenWindowStation error: 5

entering enum_winsta_proc, winsta_name = SAWinSta
OpenWindowStation error: 5
entering enum_winsta_proc, winsta_name = Service-0x0-39442180$

entering enum_winsta_proc, winsta_name = Service-0x0-4cc682fc$

entering enum_winsta_proc, winsta_name = Service-0x1-6f835ca4$
entering enum_winsta_proc, winsta_name = Service-0x1-73874238$
posting WM_CLOSE to window 0x16D012E owned by thread of pid 1344
executable for process is perl.exe

It seems likely that the more locked-down security model of Vista/Win7 had made the strategy of enumerating all window stations/desktops to find the window associated with a PID is no longer viable.

Since we KNOW what window station we created the process with in the first place, we should probably use that information. At the very least we should start by checking the current desktop for rather than enumerating all desktops.
